p: M. tuberculosis H37Ra ATCC 25177 was grown on Löwenstein-Jensen slopes (BioMaxima, Lublin, Poland) for two weeks. Bacterial mass was transferred to 7H9-S medium (Middlebrook 7H9 broth supplemented with 10% ADC-albumin dextrose catalase and 0.2% glycerol; (Becton Dickinson, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) and vortexed with glass beads. After 30 min of incubation for lager clumps sedimentation, upper phase was transferred to a sterile tube and left for 15 min. Next, supernatant was placed in a fresh tube and was adjusted to 0.5 McFarland standard with 7H9-S broth. The final density of inoculum in each well was approx. 5 × 10 5 CFU/mL.
